rComments: Prof. Bergen is at the top of her field, and that's clear from the moment she starts lecturing. Don't let that intimidate you, though! She's incredibly kind and loves hearing students speak in lecture. Exams are a little annoying with the level of detail recall required, but it's totally worth it. Be prepared to learn a LOT.

Professor Bergen is one of the best professors at U of T. I have loved every class I have taken with her. She is very knowledgeable about her topic and is very easy to approach. Her tests can be challenging (study the details and look at old tests when possible) but her exam prep classes are always very helpful.
teacherRatingTags: ['Get ready to read', "Skip class? You won't pass.", 'Gives good feedback']

rComments: She is amazing, really cares about her students and taught very heavy material in a great way. I got a lot of support during the year and ended up with a decent grade having done 20% of the readings (don't be me though), course average was a B. I also didn't take the first half of this course and managed.
teacherRatingTags: ['Accessible outside class', 'Lots of homework', 'Gives good feedback']

rComments: Professor Bergen is extremely passionate about the course and is always encouraging and enthusiastic when students participate. She doesn't have powerpoints, so you need to show up to class and take notes on what she's saying, but the exam is very fair.
teacherRatingTags: ["Skip class? You won't pass.", 'Participation matters', 'Amazing lectures']

rComments: I loved Prof Bergen. She was so amazing, she cared a lot about her students and she was very passionate about the course work. I would really recommend taking a class with her.

She is unquestionably an expert in her field BUT is incredibly rude. I have never encountered a professor at the UofT with her kind of attitude; often refusing to attend office hours - leaving caring students to constantly rely on TAs for help/advice. Unacceptable. This is coming from a student who is very interested in the Holocaust and the WWII.

Amazing lecturer. She provides insight on a topic (the Holocaust) that deepens one's knowledge of the subject and makes the class interesting and interactive. A LOT of textbooks required, but most can be found within the library. Would love any class she's teaching. Best part? Ask her to sing a song about Hitler's testicles.

Professor Bergen is one of the most knowledgeable professors I have ever had the pleasure of being taught by thus far at UofT. She knows her stuff and lectures are very interesting. I would definitely recommend her class.
A great professor!  Enjoyed having her as a prof

I just recently finished a course with Professor Bergen, and at the end of the exam I had the chance to speak to her. She is the best professor I have spoken to thus far, and she's just generally a great person! Her lectures are always very informative, interesting and inspirational. She influenced my decision in pursuing a History minor.
Very interesting lecturer and class.  Knows her topic.  Class can be hard to get into since so many want to take it.

lectures were a bit hard to follow. it was difficult to understand what she expected from us and what the main areas of study were. For instance, a lot of emphasis was placed on primary documents for a survey course. Her final exams were unique as well. Large portion of overall grade assigned to tutorial participation.

in regards to the course changed the marking scheme to put m.c, matching, map quiz,terms ta's couldn't even explain how to do the analytical comparison essay properly or the goal. puts small detailed questions on the test that throws you off.
Professor Bergen is one of the best professors at the University. the class was really interesting as well

During every class there is a slide that lists ~25 terms that will be discussed. That is A LOT of material to cover in one hour. She often has to rush to get through it all. It's a shame, because she is a very good prof. Disclaimer: Despite being a survey course, Bergen focuses primarily on Germany and Russia. I found it a little boring.

One of the best history professors at U of T, both of her classes took the Holocaust and examined it from different angles, while relating it to the broader context of WWII. The course is interactive with movies,memoirs, photo etc. and the assignments & tests are more than fair.  Would recommend it to anyone who is interested in the Holocaust.

Amazing Prof! very knowledgeable, and her enthusiasm is infectious. Interesting readings. Makes great use of film and class discussions so that its not a straight two hour lecture... final assignment can be tricky since you can do anything from a paper to dance...its good to make sure you talk to your ta and work with them in order to do well...

Amazing prof, a leader in her field and extraordinarily knowledgeable. Heavy reading load (grad course) but usually worth it. My grade was puzzling, a bit lower than expected, but still a one-of-a-kind teacher with whom to make contact.
Best professor in then universe. Have had her for three classes and am madly in love with her. She is brilliant and very engaging. Also, she is incredibly sexy, in the way only a historian can be.
One of the best professors I've ever had- she is absolutely amazing!
she has the ability to teach about "difficult" history with in an engaging, appropriate and riviting manner.

I found prof. Bergen to be the most helpful professor I have had. She was very approachable and knowledgeable about the Holocaust and Gender Studies. I recommend that everyone take a course with her. I just love this prof.

Absolutely brilliant lecturer - she knows the holocaust inside and out. As she's quite eminent in the field, having her as a Professor is an honour. Her enthusiasm and knowledge are unmatched, everything you could want in a Professor!

Noticed that she wasn't on RMP yet, so I decided to post her to see what everyone else thought. I took HIS241 with Kranjc in the first half of the semester, and continued with Bergen for HIS242. All I can say is, Kranjc is definiately a better lecturer. Bergen tends to go over past material too often, and goes off track. She's nice though!
